result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip O. Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $3,750.00 payable to Wells Fargo Bank located at 4015 N. Oakland Ave., joint and several with case #15CF1578, Jamila Troop.

Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge. Court ordered all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
***06-22-2016 Per clerical error, DRGOD assessment added.
Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 417 DAYS time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with any Wells Fargo Bank location, Labirea W., the Walgreen's located at 2950 N. Oakland Avenue and Jamila Troop.

Follow all rules of extended supervision.
Complete parenting class.
Undergo Cognitive Intervention Programming.

Obtain an AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens administered one time per month by agent; no illegal drugs; no controlled substances unless by valid prescription.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm and body armor possession and voting.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Phillip Obrian Conner in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Phillip Obrian Conner in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
*JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE CONEN*
Case calendared for sentencing hearing and called with case #15CF1886.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.  Negotiations placed on the record by the state.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the state, defense and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 417 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Obtain an AODA assessment and successfully complete follow-up treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety with random urine screens administered one time per month by agent; no illegal drugs; no controlled substances unless by valid prescription;
* Follow all rules of extended supervision.
* Complete parenting class.
* Undergo Cognitive Intervention Programming.
* No contact with any Wells Fargo Bank location, Labirea W., the Walgreen's located at 2950 N. Oakland Avenue and Jamila Troop.
* Provide a DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge.
* Pay restitution in the amount of $3,750.00 payable to Wells Fargo Bank located at 4015 N. Oakland Ave., joint and several with case #15CF1578, Jamila Troop.

Court ordered all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution to be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm and body armor possession and voting.  Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  AS TO COUNT #1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  The Court VACATED the May 31, 2016 Jury Trial date.  Matter set for sentencing on May 31, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg
Restitution Worksheet, filed.

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  
Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Pretrial conference.  Defendant prepared to enter change of plea; forms submitted.  Negotiations set forth by the state.  
Defendant no longer wishes to enter change of plea.  State's motion for joinder filed on 3-15-16 heard and granted by the Court.  
The Court orders this case joined for jury trial with 15CF001886.  State to file witness list and proposed jury instructions by 4-22-16.  The Court to accept negotiations up to 4-22-16.  
Defense to contact the court for hearing date if resolution is reached between the parties.  Case REMAINS set for Jury Trial on 5-31-16 at 9:00 a.m before Branch 30.
for Joinder, received and filed.

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Catelin Ringersma for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea.  The Defendant is now requesting a jury trial.  The Court indicated that the State has to file their Joinder motion no later than April 1, 2016.  Matter is set for a pre-trial conference on April 15, 2016 at 8:30am and a Jury Trial on May 31, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a plea hearing.  In starting the plea, the Court found some issues, and adjourned the matter to January 27, 2016 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a plea hearing.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a pre-trial conference.  The Court and Attorney Kulkoski are currently in trial.  Matter set for a plea hearing on January 13, 2016 at 1:30pm in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Glen B. Kulkoski in court, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody and not produced.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Status Conference.  Attorney Kulkoski was just appointed to the case and has not received all the discovery from prior counsel.  Matter set for a pretrial conference on DEcember 3, 2015 at 1:30pm and a Jury Trial on January 27, 2016 at 9:00am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Plea Hearing.  The Defendant informed the Court that he is requesting new defense counsel.  The Court GRANTED the request and allowed Attorney Bihler to withdraw.  The Court also informed the Defendant that this is the LAST TIME he can request new counsel.  Matter is adjourned to October 12, 2015 at 8:30am for status of counsel in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for a Final Pre-trial.  Discussions held with the Court off the record.  The Court VACATED the September 28, 2015 Jury Trial date.  That date is now going to a plea hearing.  Matter is adjourned to September 28, 2015 at 8:30am for a plea hearing before Br. 30, Judge Conen's court.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Phillip Obrian Conner not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter here for Final Pretrial conference.  Stipulated request for adjournment, received and filed.  Matter is adjourned to September 198, 2015 at 8:30am in Br. 30, Judge Conen's court for a final pretrial conference.
Deputy Court Clerk tg

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a trial date.

 ALL PARTIES ARE NOTIFIED AS OF AUGUST 1, 2015, THIS CASE WILL BE REASSIGNED TO JUDGE JEFFREY CONEN, BRANCH 30, IN ROOM 635 OF THE COURTHOUSE, DUE TO JUDICIAL ROTATION.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 08-28-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 09-28-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 30, Judge Conen's Court.

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler in court, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Status Conference date.
Case adjourned to 07-16-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Attorney Douglas Michael Bihler appears telephonically, defendant Phillip O. Conner not in court, in custody.  
Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Scheduling conference.  Parties engaged in negotiations.  
Defense needs time to confer with his client regarding offer; request for adjourned scheduling date granted.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with attorney Douglas Michael Bihler.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Lora VanderSchaaf-Village of Shorewood Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring (24 HOUR CURFEW),  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with WELLS FARGO BANK.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Phillip O. Conner in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Phillip O. Conner in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
